articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Manpho Unhwa Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Manpho Unhwa Factory
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Manpho Unhwa Factory alive with the dynamic drive for pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology.
					 After being briefed on the factory in front of a huge map showing its panoramic view, he went round the exterior and interior of the rebuilt factory to acquaint himself in detail with the technological updating and production there. 
					
					 After walking round the production processes, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the workers of the factory modernized and scientized it on the basis of the latest technology and brought about a dramatic turn in the production in a short span of time through the active development of new technology. He highly praised them for having completed the difficult and complicated project for technological updating requiring high technology.
					
					 The officials and technicians of the factory put overall production processes on a CNC basis through close creative cooperation with teachers and researchers of Kim Chaek University of Technology and completed a Korean-style integrated automation system on this basis, thereby radically changing the appearance of the factory and significantly boosting the production while economizing lots of raw and other materials in a few years, he said. Appreciating this as a great success, he extended thanks to the teachers and researchers of the university and workers in other related units for their great contribution to the technological updating of the factory. 
					
					 Noting that the research group of the university has made a great contribution to the modernization and scientization of factories and enterprises in the past, he expressed firm belief that the group would play a vanguard role in the drive for settling scientific and technological problems arising in developing the nation's industry in the future, too. 
					
					 In recent years the factory invented dozens of new valuable technologies and rapidly increased the production, he said, adding that this is the precious fruition of the dynamic drive for pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology with extraordinary determination to glorify the country before the world by means of intelligence and technology.
					
					 He highly praised the officials, workers and technicians making uninterrupted advance and innovations without a moment's stagnation and marking time for their revolutionary work style, enterprising work attitude and noble love for the country and the factory. 
					
					 Calling on the factory to continue dynamically dashing ahead toward a higher eminence of science and technology on the basis of the achievements made by putting the production on a CNC basis, he set a goal to be attained in the near future and showed such deep loving care as unraveling the problems raised.
					
					 Looking at a variety of consumer goods made by the factory through an effective use of by-products, he said that their quality is high. He appreciated the devoted service rendered by the workers of the factory for improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 Making the rounds of supply service facilities including the canteen and the bean processing shop newly built by the factory, he expressed great satisfaction over the good living conditions provided to the workers. He said that everything including production is going on well at the factory as it is supported by good supply service.
					
					 He expressed great expectation and conviction that the officials and workers of the factory would creditably perform the role of the vanguard and shock brigade in the worthwhile struggle to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology in the future, too.
					
					 He was accompanied by Pak To Chun, chief secretary of the Jagang Provincial Committee of the WPK, Jang Song Thaek, vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and department director of the WPK Central Committee, Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and Kim Kyong Hui, Thae Jong Su and Hong Sok Hyong, department directors of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: E-map on Climate for Agriculture Completed
articles.content:
E-map on Climate for Agriculture Completed
 Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- E-detailed map on climate for agriculture in Korea was produced.
					 This map produced on the basis of the geographical information system indicates 21 basic indexes and 147 specific indexes necessary for agricultural production ranging from hot and warm weather indexes to precipitation, wind, season and climatic indexes likely to cause natural disasters. 
					
					 Most of the indexes given on the map have high accuracy.
					
					 The scientists and researchers of the Central Meteorological Institute of the Hydro-Meteorological Service, the faculty of global environment of Kim Il Sung University and the Geographical Institute under the State Academy of Sciences scientifically defined average climate values through the introduction of new interpolation of Korean style on the basis of comprehensive analysis and estimation of the climatic features of the country for three decades from the 1970s to 2000 and succeeded in completing the above-said map dealing with the whole country, provinces, cities and counties as units.
					
					 The map made in the forms of a distribution map and diagrams making it possible to comprehensively and substantially get information about climate in respective areas provides another guarantee for rapidly developing the nation's agriculture.

articles.title: Rare Birds Appear on Shore of Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Rare Birds Appear on Shore of Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu
 Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- A stilt appeared on the shore of Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu on Sept. 3, drawing keen interest of people.
					 This bird is known to find its habitat in Northwest China, on the coast of the Caspian Sea, on the islands of the Mediterranean and in Africa, Australia and other places. It is quite rare that a flock of these birds fly past the coast of the West Sea of Korea in spring and autumn.
					
					 According to the results of the observation made by the Group for Comprehensive Exploration of Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu, the wing of the bird is 25cm long, its bill 7cm long and it weighs 150g.
					
					 It is a big bird with thin and straight bill, and its head, back, waist and lower part of its body are white, its wings are black and its legs are red.
					
					 Earlier, a wood sandpiper was observed on the shore of Lake Chon.
					
					 It is mysterious, indeed, that these birds found in relatively warm areas appeared on the above-said shore.
					
					 Dozens of species of birds have been observed and confirmed so far.
					
					 The habitation of various species of birds on the above-said shore indicates that this area is turning favorable for animals to live.

articles.title: Withdrawal of US and Their Followers Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Withdrawal of US and Their Followers Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification issued a statement on Sept. 8 on the lapse of the 65 years since the U.S. imperialists' occupation of south Korea.
					 The statement recalled that 65 years since the U.S. imperialists occupied south Korea were a period during which they intensified the fascist dictatorial rule by putting forward pro-Japanese elements and traitors to the nation, killed patriotic people aspiring after independence, democracy and reunification and brought the dark clouds of war to always hang over this land.
					
					 It accused the U.S. of working hard to legalize its presence in south Korea, while frantically kicking up a nuclear war racket against the DPRK, and the Lee Myung Bak forces of bringing to a collapse the inter-Korean relations which had favorably developed after the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration, cracking down upon the struggle for independence against the U.S. and tightening alliance for a war with the U.S. and Japan.
					
					 In order to put an end to the tragedy of national division it is necessary for all Koreans to pool their efforts to pull the U.S. forces out of this land and eliminate their stooges, the "Grand National Party" and Lee Myung Bak dictatorial forces, it noted.
					
					 It called on all the fellow countrymen to conduct a vigorous struggle for the withdrawal of the U.S. troops and the elimination of traitors by their concerted efforts.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Reparation for Crime-Woven Past
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Reparation for Crime-Woven Past
 Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, released a statement on Sept. 6 in connection with the lapse of a century since the fabrication of the "Korea-Japan Annexation Treaty" by the Japanese imperialists.
					 The statement recalled that the Japanese imperialists forced Korea to conclude the above-said treaty in wanton violation of the elementary principles and regulations on the conclusion of an international treaty in a bid to exterminate the Korean nation 100 years ago.
					
					 After illegally occupying Korea the Japanese imperialists enforced a harsh colonial rule over it and reduced the Koreans to their miserable colonial slaves, committing countless crimes against humanity in Korea, it noted.
					
					 The statement urged Japan to make sincere apology and reparation to the Korean people for imposing unspeakable misfortune and disasters upon them and immediately stop its acts of distorting history.
					
					 The organization will join all the peace-loving people in the world in conducting a more dynamic just struggle to force Japan to settle its past crimes, declared the statement.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Mexico
						
Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" was brought out in pamphlet by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism on Sept. 5.
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997), clarifies the idea that preserving the Juche character and national character of the revolution and construction is a main principle to be maintained in accomplishing the socialist cause and tasks and ways to do so.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Bulgaria, France, Switzerland and Mongolia and an opening ceremony of a Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition in Brazil from Sept. 1 to 3 on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					On display in the venue of the exhibition were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos showing their exploits, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the wisdom and talents of the Korean people.
					
					 Speeches were made at the events.
					
					 The mayor of Sboge City of Bulgaria and the chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association expressed conviction that under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people would surely emerge victorious in the struggle to frustrate the imperialists' vicious moves against the DPRK, build a thriving nation and achieve national reunification.
					
					 The delegate president of the France-Korea Friendship Association said that Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK, enabling the Korean people to emerge genuine masters of the country and fully enjoy a worthwhile life and turning the country into a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 The Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il serves as a weapon for firmly defending the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK despite the evermore undisguised moves of the U.S. imperialists to threaten and stifle it by force of arms and guaranteeing peace and security in the Korean Peninsula, Asia and the rest of the world, the delegate president noted.
					
					 The mayor of Santos City of Sao Paulo State of Brazil stressed that the exhibition would mark an important occasion in promoting the understanding of the DPRK among the Brazilian people including the citizens of Santos City and boosting the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two governments and peoples.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings held in Bulgaria, France and Switzerland.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Observed
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Observed 
 Pyongyang, September 12 (KCNA) -- An event for laying a floral basket before a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung took place at the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America on Sept. 8 on the occasion of the 62nd birthday of the DPRK.
					 It was attended by Alfonso Fraga Perez, secretary-general of the OSPAAL, and its staff members, Kwon Sung Chol, DPRK ambassador to Cuba, and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the portrait of the smiling President and paid tribute to him.
